event: Meeting of the Presidium of the General Council of United Russia
description: The Presidium of the General Council of United Russia, led by Andrei Turchak, held a meeting to discuss the party's role in the presidential elections. United Russia played a crucial role in collecting signatures in support of Vladimir Putin and mobilized over 31 million supporters. The meeting also determined the dates for preliminary voting to select candidates for regional elections in 40 Russian regions.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
Took part in a meeting of the Presidium of the General Council of United Russia, chaired by Andrei Turchak. The results of the participation of party activists in the presidential elections were summed up: the United Russia party played a key role in collecting signatures in support of Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin and was able to mobilize a turnout of more than 31 million supporters. He spoke and talked about what ensured good results in the presidential elections in the DPR and what significant impact the activity of the regional branch of the party had.

In addition, during the meeting, the dates for preliminary voting were determined to determine candidates from United Russia for the regional elections in September in 40 Russian regions.

I would like to note separately that each preliminary voting candidate from United Russia who is a member of the SVO will automatically receive 25% of the votes received. The party began to involve former military personnel in politics, many have already become deputies at various levels. This is important and fair: these are the people who deserve to rule the state. @PushilinDenis

description: Moldova's Minister of Economy, Alaiba, emphasized the need for increased exports to the EU, stating that it would bring in cash, support jobs, and drive growth. He aims to make exporting easier for companies.
original:
New economic ideas from the Minister of Economy of Moldova Alaiba.

The minister, fresh from the joy of economic growth of 0.7% a year, announced that "we need more exports to the EU. And more exporters. Exporting means cash flowing into the country and supporting jobs, wages, investment and growth."

Alaiba says that "the EU market should provide opportunities to as many companies as possible. Doing business, including exporting, should be easy."

And now it’s time to ask the question - why doesn’t Moldova simply increase exports, regardless of the EU? After all, more exports, no matter where, means more cash than being an extension of the European Union, where there are a lot of barriers.

But the fact is that for “good people” the economy is geopoliticized and ideologized, so outside the EU there are not only countries, but also markets and even life itself (for them there is no life in Moldova either, here they are purely temporary). Therefore - only in the EU, only hardcore. But immediately after Ukraine, it is not good to engage in exports that go against the interests of Ukraine.

description: Artem 'Ronin' Zhigadlo, a Ukrainian soldier, died in combat. He fought in several battles, including the defense of Kyiv, the Zaporizhia campaign, and near Bakhmut and Avdiivka. He was a loyal son of Ukraine and a skilled soldier.
original:
Forwarded from: ✙Medvezhatko✙|🍉
Friend. Brother. Warrior. Idealist. Stormtrooper
Our admin.

How much we still had to do. So much was planned by us.
I didn't believe anything could happen to you.
You took part in the defense of Kyiv, passed along and across hundreds of cursed landings during the Zaporizhia campaign, and then - for almost a year, you fought in the most difficult conditions near Bakhmut. Now - Avdiivka. It seemed that you would be able to survive the fiercest battle, so that later with a loud laugh at a table in a cafe, you would talk about how you beat up the underdogs and how many times you came out victorious. And also - you will brag about the collected trophies.
We'll discuss how to develop our project, and you'll generate joke after joke that will make us both sick to our stomachs.

I have no words to express how I felt when I was told that you had died.
The brigade lost one of its best soldiers. Ukraine is one of the most loyal sons.
I am another one of the few close friends whose circle is constantly narrowing and whose number remains less and less.

You are gone. But we still have something to live for. What to fight for. And for whom to fight.
You will forever remain in my memory. And I will never let you fade away. For the sake of us, those who are alive. For the sake of those who have already left. And for the sake of those who have not yet been born.

Artem "Ronin" Zhigadlo.

Always faithful.
Always in line.
Always in our hearts.

And our task now is to help Artem's family and relatives. He is survived by his mother and a pregnant bride. 🔗Link to the bankhttps://send.monobank.ua/jar/2cw25zBQuk💳Card number

description: Igor Salikov, a businessman, reported an attack on his home where he was beaten and pepper-sprayed. He claims to have recognized the attacker as a former detective who had previously tortured him in 2018.
original:
A reputable businessman from the 90s, Igor Salikov, who became a victim in a high-profile torture case in 2018, again reported an attack - they broke into his house, poured pepper on him and beat him on the head with a stool. The victim claims that he recognized the old offender in the villain.

Six years ago, Igor Mikhailovich, well-known in certain circles, got into an extremely delicate situation - during a search in his private home, a man was injured by an operative. The method was sophisticated - the owner was laid on the floor and struck in the anus with a Tiger carbine, causing him serious injuries to his internal organs. The employee was sentenced to four years in prison and dismissed from the authorities, but he never admitted guilt.

According to our information, Igor Salikov again contacted the authorities. He said that the night before the villain again entered the home - a strong man in a sports jacket with a hood and a medical mask. The aggressor sprayed pepper spray in his face, knocked him to the floor and began kicking him, and then hit him with a stool. However, the entrepreneur managed to resist and even pull off his mask. Then he recognized the face - he said it was the same former detective who had already served his sentence and was at large. According to Salikov himself, the police are already conducting an investigation.

UPD: Igor Salikov finally got in touch with us. Now his position is this: he did not file any statements, no one attacked him in the house, he did not receive any threats from the former operative. A few hours ago, the man refused to comment with journalists with the verbatim wording: “I can’t comment on anything yet.” Mash on the Moika - St. Petersburg news

event: Road Repairs to Saur-Mogila Memorial Complex
description: The Ministry of Transport reported that major repairs are underway on the road to the Saur-Mogila memorial complex. Road workers are restoring sections of regional roads, including Manuylovka-Dmitrovka and Snezhnoye-Marinovka, with a total length of about 50 km. The repairs aim to ensure unimpeded passage to the memorial complex.
original:
Major repairs of the road to the Saur-Mogila memorial complex are ongoing, the Ministry of Transport reported.

Road workers of the State Company "Avtodor" have resumed work on the regional roads Manuylovka - Dmitrovka and Snezhnoye - Marinovka, where sections with a total length of about 50 km are planned for restoration.

Currently, the roadside area within the right of way is being cleared, culverts are being reconstructed and the old road surface is being milled. In addition, road workers have begun to bring the width of traffic lanes to Russian standards.

After completion of work on these sections of roads, unimpeded passage from the village of Snezhnoye to the Marinovka automobile checkpoint, as well as to the Saur-Mogila memorial complex, will be ensured.@PRO_respubliku

I am grateful to Governor Evgeniy Vitalievich Balitsky for supporting our talented youth, who have the opportunity to realize their ideas and contribute to the popularization of art in the Zaporozhye region.

description: Deputy Sergei Turusin, who produces films about election fraud, received threats after releasing the 18th episode of his film 'Mafia', which claimed the 2018 presidential elections in Russia were illegitimate. Turusin predicted similar falsifications in the 2024 elections. He was threatened with a criminal case and police officers called his family, inviting him for interrogation.
original:
A Samara deputy who makes films about fraud in the presidential elections is threatened with a criminal case. Sergei Turusin in 2011 was elected as a deputy of the Samara Provincial Duma from the Communist Party of the Russian Federation. Now he is a deputy of the Kirovsky district council of Samara. Since 2016, Turusin has been releasing films under the title “Mafia” about election fraud.

On March 11, the deputy published the next, 18th episode of the film “Mafia”, in which it is stated that the 2018 presidential elections in the Russian Federation are illegitimate. Turusin also predicted that similar falsifications would occur in the 2024 elections, writes the Zasekin publication.

According to the deputy, the actual turnout at most polling stations did not exceed 44%. The Russian Central Election Commission reported that the turnout was a record 77.4%.

Turusin received threats demanding that he not publish any films about violations before the presidential elections in March 2024. The next day after the film was released, two paddy wagons with a capture group arrived at the deputy’s house, but the security forces did not find Turusin at home.

The deputy himself told Zasekin that police officers call his family and invite him to appear for interrogation on his own - then allegedly he will only be subject to an administrative article about “discrediting” the army and will get off with a fine. If the deputy is detained by the security forces themselves, he will face a real prison sentence, the publication writes.

———Screenshot: YouTube channel of Sergei Turusin.

description: The Milan 2024 naval exercise, led by India, brought together 51 naval delegations, 16 foreign ships, and a patrol aircraft from France. The exercise aimed to promote comradeship, cohesion, and cooperation among participating nations. The nine-day event featured sporting and cultural events, a parade, and a joint satellite communications network called NISHAR.
original:
The Milan 2024 naval exercise took place in the Bay of Bengal, which brought together the United States, Iran and Russia, led by India. Exercise Milan has been held every two years since 1995. If previously they had a regional character, now they have turned into an international event. The purpose of the exercise in India is called “comradeship, cohesion and cooperation.” In total, 51 naval delegations, 16 foreign ships and one patrol aircraft from France took part in the exercise. A peculiarity of the maneuvers is that on one side were warships of the United States - the destroyer USS Halsey, Iran - the frigate IRIS Dena and the Russian Federation deployed several ships at once - the cruiser "Varyag", the destroyer "Marshal Shaposhnikov" and "Boris Chilikin" and the tanker of the "Boris" class Butoma".

The exercise itself lasted nine days in Visakhapatnam. These included sporting and cultural events on the shore, as well as a parade in the city to demonstrate the friendliness between the parties. The most important part took place at sea, where India launched its two aircraft carriers INS Vikramaditya and INS Vikrant for the first time. The latter was designed and built in India.

The Indian Navy also introduced a joint satellite communications network during the exercise called NISHAR (Network for Information SHARing). Communication terminals have been distributed among all participants to better coordinate operations.@yigal_levin

description: A group of people, including a Ministry of Internal Affairs representative, demolished a dog shelter in Samara, frightening the dogs, including an old dog named Gavryusha, who died of fear.
original:
A harmless dog from Samara was scared to death by people who came to destroy his shelter. The townspeople demand that the perpetrators be punished.

An old dog named Gavryusha and his three tailed friends - vaccinated and sterilized - lived next to the church. The locals loved them - they set up a booth and fed them. For four whole years, the animals never showed aggression and were grateful to the care of the parishioners.

Paradise life ended when citizen Elena P. persistently demanded that the police demolish the doghouses. There were no legal grounds, but people came with crowbars (judging by the form, representatives of housing and communal services) accompanied by a gentleman from the Ministry of Internal Affairs. The frightened dogs were dispersed. And Gavryusha crawled out of fear to the neighboring house. There the dog's heart could not stand it. They found the old man already dead.

Shocked Samara residents inundated the local police and prosecutor's office with petitions asking them to punish those responsible for the cruel treatment. And in memory of the dog who completed her earthly journey, lights were raised into the sky.

- Was I a good boy?
- No. You were the best. Subscribe to Mash

Show more
The family moved to the city from Yakutia five years ago - they wanted to change the climate + dreamed of a home. We designed and built everything with our own hands. Since February 22, we have been volunteering, weaving camouflage nets, and donating humanitarian aid.
From the beginning of March they complained about the increasing frequency of shelling, but did not want to leave. Yesterday at 11:30 it flew into their private house on Druzhby Street - everyone died except Katya. She is in intensive care, the prognosis is good.

description: Retired Navy officer Joseph Dituri, also known as Dr. Deep Sea, spent 100 days underwater in a lagoon at a depth of 9 meters in Key Largo, Florida. His experiment showed a 50% reduction in inflammatory markers, a 17-fold increase in stem cells, and a reversal of his biological age from 44 to 34 years old.
original:
100 days underwater: an experiment that rejuvenated the body but reduced height Joseph Dituri, known as Dr. Deep Sea, set a world record for living under water. The man spent more than 3 months, namely 100 days, under water. To realize his plan, the professor was placed in a special container.

Retired Navy officer Joseph Dituri may have unlocked the key to rejuvenation that lies deep under the sea, the Daily Star reports. After living for 100 days in a lagoon at a depth of 9 meters in Key Largo, Florida, he was able to stop the aging process of his body.

A blood test taken from Joseph at the end of his 100-day underwater cycle showed a 50% reduction in inflammatory markers in his body, as well as a 17-fold increase in the number of stem cells. “So I have stem cell proliferation, less pain, less inflammation and toxin inhibition. Now I am 56 years old. My external biological age was 44 years old. When I came out of the water my outer age was 34 years old. My telomeres have lengthened. I actually became younger when I was underwater,” he told WKMG News.

Despite the improvement in Dr. Dituri's health while under water, the scientist became three-quarters of an inch shorter. Subscribe /Eng Twitter/YouTube /Eng Telegram

According to a source from the Cheka-OGPU, the incident occurred on March 18 at around 15.00 on Oboronnaya Street. The police tried to stop two suspicious men to check their documents. Passers-by rushed to run away from the police officers and threw an F-1 grenade at those who were catching up. Miraculously, no one was hurt, and one of the fugitives was caught and detained. He turned out to be 34-year-old Alexei Shatilov, who had been previously convicted several times. In the criminal chronicles of Penza they wrote about him that after another stint in a colony for juvenile delinquents, he and his dungeon friends organized a gang and engaged in thefts, hijackings and robberies, during one of which they killed a woman for 60 rubles. description: Nikol Pashinyan met with residents of Kirants, Tavush region, to discuss the demarcation and delimitation process of Armenia's borders. He emphasized the importance of consolidating Armenia's territorial integrity and recognizing its borders according to international agreements.
original: Nikol Pashinyan during a meeting with residents of the village of Kirants, Tavush region: We must be active in order to fix the borders of Armenia within this internationally recognized territory. I came here because the demarcation process may cause some problems for some settlements, but on the other hand, the situation is such that it is logical that the process of demarcation and delimitation will begin from the territory from Baganis to Berkaber. Demarcation is when we fix the coordinates of the border on the map, and delimitation is when we walk, stand on the ground and say: Armenia begins or ends here. It is important for us to consolidate the territorial integrity of Armenia. Our problem today with a number of countries in the region is that we want them to recognize the territorial integrity of Armenia according to the agreement. But if we want others to recognize it, we must first recognize it ourselves. I have come to say that this is the only way to build our future. The most important result of delimitation may be that the troops will leave their positions and be replaced by border guards. Where the border guards are stationed, it is not customary to shoot at each other, and, in fact, there is no territorial dispute in this area. At the moment, we have no agreement with anyone, no decision, nothing that you don’t know about. @Caucasian_bureau

description: A solar explosion on March 17 formed a 'canyon of fire' in the Sun's atmosphere, which is expected to cause a G1 class magnetic storm on Earth on March 20. This will lead to aurora displays, particularly in Central Russia due to the spring Russell-McPherron effect.
original:
🌞🌞🌞An explosion on the Sun formed a “canyon of fire”, which the day after tomorrow will cause a magnetic storm on Earth: “On March 17, NASA’s Solar Dynamics Observatory recorded an explosion on the Sun that formed a “canyon of fire” in the atmosphere of the star. According to the forecast, the impact on the Earth's magnetic field will occur on March 20 and will cause the aurora. So a G1 class magnetic storm is likely in the middle of the week.
Taking into account the equinox, the northern lights in Central Russia should be beautiful. At this time of year, even a glancing blow can cause geomagnetic storms thanks to the spring Russell-McPherron effect.
The frequency of powerful geomagnetic storms, and with them bright auroras, increases around the dates of the autumn and spring equinoxes. This effect is associated with the seasonal orientation of the Earth's magnetic field relative to the solar wind field. The main thing is that there are no clouds.” https://t.me/dimsmirnov175/66833

description: Anti-government protests broke out in at least five locations across Cuba, including Santiago, in response to crackdowns, power outages, and food shortages. The US government has called on the Cuban government to respect the human rights of protesters and address the needs of the Cuban people.

Militarist US authorities say the protests in Cuba demonstrate a "dire situation" and deny any involvement...Cuba's Foreign Ministry said it had summoned the top US diplomat on the island to a meeting following the protests on Sunday, accusing the US embassy in Havana of seeking to incite more violence. widespread anti-government uprising and interference in Cuba's internal affairs.

Rallies protesting against crackdowns, hours-long power outages and food shortages broke out Sunday in at least five places across the island, including Cuba's second-largest city Santiago.

The US government said on Platform X late Sunday that it was monitoring the protests and called on the Cuban government to "respect the human rights of protesters and address the legitimate needs of the Cuban people."

description: Doctors at the Krasnodar Emergency Hospital successfully performed facial reconstruction surgery on a 24-year-old Senegalese albino patient, Khadim Deme, who had melanoma. The patient underwent a 20-hour operation to restore his cheekbone and jaw with a titanium prosthesis. Further operations were conducted in a private clinic to reconstruct soft tissues, including eyelids, mouth, and fat grafting.
original:
In Krasnodar, doctors restored the face of an albino patient from Senegal with cancer. Krasnodar doctors saved a 24-year-old Senegalese albino Khadim Deme, who had melanoma developing on his face. According to Krasnodarskie Izvestia, the young man was not abandoned only in the south of Russia.

The patient's father, Serin Deme, explained that he and his wife went to clinics in Africa, but they did not take care of their son. The family sold their livestock and, with the help of an international charity foundation and social networks, raised money for chemotherapy and radiotherapy. Later, the oncology receded, and the search began for doctors to reconstruct the face. But only the Department of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery of the Krasnodar Emergency Hospital volunteered to take on such a patient.

The medical institution conducted research and built an accurate 3D model of the patient’s skull. Doctors restored the cheekbone with the soft tissues of the upper jaw and the right part of the lower jaw with a titanium prosthesis. The operation lasted about 20 hours. Later, the Senegalese underwent the final operation in a private clinic. He underwent soft tissue reconstruction, including reconstruction of the eyelids and mouth, as well as fat grafting of the soft tissues of the face.

“Out of 100% of the possibilities, we have already returned more than ninety to him. Next, Khadim’s dentition will be restored—dental implantation and permanent dentures will be performed,” noted Aleksey Dikarev, candidate of medical sciences, oncologist, plastic surgeon, and reconstructive surgeon.

For now, the patient has been fitted with a nasogastric tube for feeding and drinking. Khadim Deme is under medical supervision around the clock. After 1.5 weeks, the African is scheduled to have his stitches removed and undergo implantation.

description: Estonian Prime Minister Kaja Kallas clarified that there was no discussion about sending ground troops to Ukraine at the European leaders' summit in Paris. She defended Macron, stating that the conversation was about sending instructors to train Ukrainian soldiers, and it would be more effective to do so on Ukrainian territory.
original:
🇪🇪🇫🇷No one spoke about sending ground troops to Ukraine at the summit of European leaders in Paris, including Macron, “there was some confusion due to the terms used in English” - Estonian Prime Minister Kaja Kallas “We We also discussed whether the military and representatives of different countries could help Ukraine more effectively, and, in my opinion, all these discussions should be open.

In whose interests is it for us to say very clearly that we definitely won’t do this or that? This is in Russia's interests. Russia wants to get some kind of confirmation from us that we definitely won’t do this,” Kallas said.

The Estonian prime minister clarified that the conversation was in the context of sending instructors and that “it would be more effective to train Ukrainian soldiers on the territory of Ukraine.” This is the second time Kallas has defended Macron, who later stated that “his every word was verified.”

event: Death of Senior Sergeant Vasyl Kozak
description: Senior Sergeant Vasyl Kozak, 47, died on February 4, 2023, in a battle with occupiers near Oleksandropil village in Donetsk region. He was a brave and fair soldier who served in the Separate Presidential Brigade named after Bohdan Khmelnytskyi.
original:
​​💔Senior Sergeant Vasyl Kozak died on February 4, 2023 in a battle with the occupiers near the village of Oleksandropil in Donetsk region. The defender was 47 years old.

Vasyl was born in the village of Bystryk, Zhytomyr Region. He finished school there. After his 18th birthday, he joined the Internal Troops of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Ukraine. He dreamed of his house and family. He settled in Kyiv and met his love - Victoria, whom he married in 1996. In three years, the couple had a son, Maksym, whom they were eagerly waiting for. The boy became a comfort for his husband, Vasyl was the happiest dad, who rejoiced at all Maxim's successes and achievements, and was always his support. Over time, the family moved to Vasyl's native village, to Olga's mother, whom her husband helped with the household. He often went to see his sister Maya and her family. In 2020, after the death of his mother, he returned to Kyiv and got a job at a security firm. He tried to fix his future life, did not give up and took up his goals again.

Since the beginning of the full-scale invasion, in March 2022, the man was voluntarily mobilized into the ranks of the Armed Forces. Served in the Separate Presidential Brigade named after Bohdan Khmelnytskyi.

"Vasyl was a support for our family and a strong support for my sister Maya. For me and my sister, he was the best friend who would always tell me what to do. He loved his son very much, rejoiced at all his successes and undertakings. He was fair and brave, like his comrades, with whom he stood side by side, holding his position with dignity," said the niece and godmother of the deceased Valentyn Hushcha.

Vasyl was posthumously awarded the Badge of Honor award.

The soldier was buried in his native village in Zhytomyr Oblast. He is survived by his wife Vita, son Maksym, sister Maya, nephews, other relatives, friends and brothers. Ukrainska Pravda together with the Memorial platform honor the memory of fallen soldiers

event: Unified Form of Identification for Large Families
description: A unified form of identification for large families has been developed in Russia. The certificate, which can be electronic or paper, will be issued by social security authorities or authorized organizations at the regional level. It will enable families with three or more minor children to access regional support measures and benefits when traveling or visiting cultural institutions.
original:
A unified form of identification for a large family has been developed

A unified form of identification for a large family has been developed. The draft corresponding Government resolution has been submitted for public discussion.

The resolution will come into force from the date of its signing. The procedure for issuing certificates will be determined at the regional level. It will be possible to obtain a certificate from social security authorities or other organizations that will be authorized by the regions to issue such certificates.

The certificate is provided upon recognition of a family with many children. The certificate can be either electronic or paper. It will be used to obtain regional support measures within the subject. In addition, such a certificate can be used when traveling around the country when visiting cultural institutions.

Let us remind you that according to the Presidential Decree, a large family in the Russian Federation is a family with three or more minor children. This status is established indefinitely.@gorlovka6tv

Forwarded from: Sovereign

event: EU Imposes Tariffs on Russian and Belarusian Grain
description: The EU will introduce tariffs on grain from Russia and Belarus to appease farmers and eastern member states. The move, a first since the Russian invasion, aims to increase prices by at least 50% and reduce demand. The tariffs will be 95 euros per ton on grain and 50% on oilseeds and processed products.
original:
The EU will impose tariffs on grain from Russia and Belarus to “calm down” farmers and its eastern members, the Financial Times reports, citing sources.

This will be the first food restriction since the Russian invasion. Brussels has long resisted pressure from Poland and the Baltic states, arguing such restrictions could undermine global food markets and harm developing countries.

According to the FT, in the coming days the EC will introduce a duty of 95 euros per ton on grain from Russia and Belarus. This will increase prices by at least 50% and destroy demand. And duties of 50% will be established on oilseeds and their processed products.

EU imports from Russia of affected products reached a record 4 million tonnes in 2023, representing 1% of total EU consumption.

Earlier, the National Security and Defense Council stated that Poland, while blocking Ukrainian grain, was allowing Russian grain through in larger quantities.

FT notes that Polish farmers are now increasingly protesting against Russian food. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

event: Increase in Ukrainians Receiving News from Telegram
description: During the two-year war, the number of Ukrainians receiving news from Telegram increased from 20% to 70%. This shift in trust may be attributed to Ukrainians distrusting Russian Telegram channels and instead trusting anonymous sources. The lack of regulation in this parallel media system poses a serious threat to the stability of Ukrainian society.
original: 📈The number of Ukrainians receiving news from Telegram increased from 20% to 70% during the two years of the war🗣️According to Ihor Solovya, Ukrainians may not trust Russian Telegram channels and at the same time trust more anonymous people whom they cannot identify. In fact, we have a situation where a parallel media system is created that is not regulated by anyone. Currently, the level of trust in the state and official resources is very seriously decreasing. Something must be done about this, since citizens are not so much critical thinking, but critical towards everything that is happening. This means that the stability of our society is under serious threat, says Solovei. We would like to remind you that the results of a study conducted by the Ukrainian Telemetrio service at the end of 2023 showed that there are more than 33,000 active Telegram channels in Ukraine with a total number of 282.6 million subscribers. .DM

description: The IOC has set conditions for neutral athletes from Russia and Belarus to participate in the Paris Olympic Games. Individual athletes will have their own flag and anthem, but will not participate in the team parade during the opening ceremony. Athletes supporting the fighting in Ukraine and officials from Russia and Belarus will not be allowed to attend the games.
original:
The IOC has agreed on the conditions for the participation of neutral athletes at the Olympic Games in Paris. What awaits athletes from the Russian Federation and Belarus who will be able to obtain status?—Currently, 12 Russians and 7 Belarusians have qualified for the games. According to the most likely IOC scenario, 36 athletes with a Russian passport and 22 with a Belarusian one will attend the games. The maximum allowed number is 54 and 28, respectively (in 2020, 330 game participants came from Russia).

— Individual neutral athletes (AIN) will have their own flag and anthem. The anthem has no words; it was created exclusively for the games. The anthem will be played and the flag raised if the athlete is able to win medals. However, they will not be displayed in the overall ranking of countries.

— Neutral athletes will not participate in the team parade during the opening ceremony. A decision on their participation in the closing ceremony of the games will be made later.

— Previously, the IOC has already talked about the rules for the participation of neutral athletes. For example, we are talking only about individual sports; teams from the Russian Federation and Belarus will not be included in the games. Also, athletes and members of national teams who support the fighting in Ukraine will not go to the games. Officials from the Russian Federation and Belarus will also not be allowed to attend the games, and before the games they will need to sign a peace charter condemning the hostilities.

description: US Senator Graham visited Kyiv, urging Ukraine to pass a mobilization law and send young people under 25 to the front. He emphasized that Ukrainians should serve in the Armed Forces, regardless of US support.

I can't believe this at 27 years old. You are fighting for your life, so you should serve, not at 25 or 27 years old. We need more people,” the Washington Post quotes Graham. He also urged Ukrainians not to make their decisions about mobilization based on whether the United States continues to support them. Even in the colonial era, the metropolis was not so brazen in sending native troops to fight for the interests of “white masters.” . For the West, Ukraine turned out to be much lower than the aborigines with loincloths. Be with us - First Cossack

original:
In the Moscow region, drifters staged a show on ice in the courtyard of the Prigorod Lesnoye residential complex - it all happened at night, when people had already gone to bed. In the Moscow region, in the Prigorod Lesnoye residential complex, apartment owners that night found an unusual show on ice right in the courtyard of the school stadium under their windows. True, instead of skaters there were three cars that were driving around the skating rink.

The cars performed pirouettes and piled sideways as hard as they could. The locals, who unwittingly witnessed this concert, did not appreciate the performance - at least because everything happened closer to the night, when people were already going to bed. In addition, residents wondered how three cars managed to penetrate the fenced area. The answer to this question has not yet been received.

Everyone who destroys Russian saboteurs, destroys their drones, helps people in the border communities of Ukraine. In particular, I would like to mention the soldiers of the Sumy detachment. Senior Sergeant Yuri Vasiliev and Captain Ruslan Kravchenko - thank you, guys, for helping the locals during shelling from Russian territory. Also, the Chernihiv border detachment – sergeant Volodymyr Ignatenko and senior sergeant Yury Pavlenko. The guys oppose Russian drones, protect our people from the blows of the occupier. Also, Kharkiv border detachment - senior soldier Vladyslav Baidukov, chief sergeant Vladyslav Gurenko. Thanks for the efficiency you guys! I would also like to mention the border guards of the "Steel Border" Offensive Guard Brigade, who, together with other units of the Defense Forces, are fighting at the front and guarding our state border. Senior soldier Roman Dubovsky and sergeants Oleg Kisliy and Vladyslav Yakymenko, as well as staff sergeant Yevhen Doroshenko, especially deserve our gratitude these weeks. Thank you, warriors, and all your brothers!"🇺🇦Telegram|Facebook|YouTube|Instagram|TikTok|Twitter|Site

description: A draft of the new Water Code with amendments on water resource protection and use was presented in the Mazhilis on March 18. However, some deputies criticized the rapporteur's speech and the Water Code itself, citing inconsistencies with its concept.
original:
Forwarded from: Zakon.kz - News from Kazakhstan and the world
Deputies criticized the ministry for its work on the Water Code. On March 18, a draft of the new Water Code with accompanying amendments on the protection and use of water resources was presented in the Mazhilis. However, some deputies criticized the speech of the rapporteur on the project and the Water Code itself.

Thus, deputy Azhar Sagyndykova noted that the draft Water Code differs significantly from its concept. “I read the concept and the Water Code itself. I liked the concept much more than the Water Code itself. It’s as if you took excerpts from different bills and put them together just to create a project. Sometimes they don’t even agree on the style of speech," the deputy said.

Read more at.t.me/zakonkz

description: The leaders of the United States, Japan, and the Philippines will hold a joint meeting at the White House on April 11 to discuss economic growth, green energy development, and peace and stability in the Indo-Pacific region. The meeting may also pave the way for further military cooperation, including a potential agreement on Japanese forces' access to the Philippines' territory.
original:
🇺🇸🇯🇵🇵🇭The leaders of the United States, Japan and the Philippines will hold a joint meeting in the States in April on April 11 - immediately after the state visit of Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida, scheduled for April 10.

The agenda so far is: economic growth (on the heels of US Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo's recent trip to Manila), the development of green energy chains, and peace and stability in the Indo-Pacific region.

Regarding the second point: it is clear that the same gas is not exactly clean energy, however, based on the statements of the Ambassador of the Philippines to the United States about cooperation in the field of energy resources production, the parties will most likely talk about this during the meeting.

Such meetings form the basis for further military cooperation - trends towards the creation of a trilateral quasi-alignment have already been outlined, all that remains is for Japan and the Philippines to sign an agreement on access of Japanese forces to the country's territory (sounds scary, but it is only needed for frequent exercises).

We will not be surprised, by the way, if the parties conclude a deal in April - Manila wants to sign the document in the first quarter of this year. This will have a strong media effect and will show that the Philippines is one of the main priorities for the United States, with which Manila has signed a more serious agreement on access to bases, and Japan in the context of competition with China in the region. But, of course, all this remains speculation for now. @awaken_dragonReutersBiden, Japan's Kishida and Philippines' Marcos to hold April summit at White HouseU.S. President Joe Biden will host Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida and Philippines President Ferdinand Marcos Jr for a summit in Washington on A...

event: International Online Conference on Infectious Diseases
description: The Russian Academy of Sciences, Central Research Institute of Epidemiology of Rospotrebnadzor, and the World-Class Center for Genomic Research will host an international online conference on infectious diseases in people with reduced immunity. Experts from various countries will discuss diagnosis, clinic, treatment, and control of antimicrobial resistance.
original: ❗️On March 20 at 10:00 (Moscow time) the International online conference “Infectious diseases in people with reduced immunity: diagnosis, clinic, treatment” will take place. Organizers are the Russian Academy of Sciences and the Central Research Institute of Epidemiology of Rospotrebnadzor with the participation of the World-Class Center for Genomic Research to Ensure Biological Safety and technological independence. According to WHO, the first feature of the health status of the world population now is a decrease in immunoreactivity. According to various sources, up to 50-70% of people have immune disorders. As a result, there is an increase in the incidence of opportunistic infections caused by opportunistic microflora. During the conference, experts from different countries will present their experience in various aspects of epidemiology, diagnosis, clinical manifestations and treatment of opportunistic infections, as well as control of antimicrobial resistance. Conference program. Registration for online participation - follow the link.

event: Decrease in Counterfeit Money in Moscow Region
description: The Central Bank reported a 38% decrease in counterfeit money in the Moscow region by the end of 2023 compared to 2022. A total of 4,902 counterfeits were discovered, with 4,827 in Moscow and 75 in the Moscow region. The most frequently counterfeited notes were 5,000 ruble notes, which decreased by 4.5 times over the year.
original:
Forwarded from: REGIONS
Central Bank: the share of counterfeit money in the Moscow region has sharply decreased. By the end of 2023, the number of banknotes with signs of counterfeiting has decreased in the Moscow region. The reduction compared to 2022 was 38%, this was reported by the press service of the Main Directorate of the Bank of Russia for the Central Federal District. It is noted that a total of 4,902 counterfeits were discovered in Moscow and the region, the lion's share of which 4,827 were in the capital, and only 75 in the Moscow region. The most frequently counterfeited notes were notes of five thousand rubles. “The number of counterfeit notes of five thousand rubles decreased by 4.5 times over the year. In Moscow, 3,755 of them were identified, in the Moscow region - 62. The number of counterfeit 2,000 ruble banknotes has decreased by more than 10 times: only three such counterfeits were found in the Moscow region, the rest were found in the capital. Thousand-ruble banknotes decreased by 27%. Of the 720 identified in the Moscow region, 10 were found in the Moscow region,” the press service told a Regions correspondent. Subscribe to REGIONS

description: A rock collapse occurred in an underground mine in the Zeya Municipal District, Amur Region, trapping contractor employees. A criminal case was opened under Article 216 of the Russian Criminal Code for violating safety requirements during work.
original:
In the Amur Region, a criminal case has been opened regarding a rock collapse in a mine shaft. On March 18, while working in the workings of an underground mine in the Zeya Municipal District, a rock collapse occurred, as a result of which the contractor's employees were trapped in the mine.

Based on this fact, the investigative authorities of the Investigative Committee of Russia in the Amur Region opened a criminal case on the grounds of a crime under Art. 216 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (violation of safety requirements during work).

Currently, an investigative team with the involvement of forensic investigators from the Investigative Committee is inspecting the scene of the incident, interrogating witnesses and persons responsible for compliance with safety rules, and confiscating the necessary documentation. The data obtained during the inspection during the investigation of the criminal case will be analyzed and compared with documents regulating compliance with safety rules at this site of work. A set of investigative actions is carried out taking into account the need for rescue services to carry out the priority tasks of detecting and raising victims to the surface. Subscribe to Sledkom

event: Friendship Games Organizers Respond to IOC
description: The organizers of the Friendship Games rejected the IOC's call to boycott the tournament in Russia, labeling it as unconstructive and not aimed at sports development. They emphasized the principles of friendship, equal conditions, and no discrimination for all participants.
original:
The organizers of the Friendship Games responded to the IOC’s call to boycott the tournament in Russia. The IOC’s calls to abandon the tournament are unconstructive, the press service of the Friendship Games told Paragraph. “We are disappointed to see such statements from the International Olympic Committee. This position, in our opinion, is unconstructive and is not aimed at the development of sports, which is facilitated by the emergence of new commercial formats of competitions with a serious organizational level and attractive conditions for athletes,” the organizers noted. The organizing committee also stated that the key principles of the World Games are friendship are equal conditions and the absence of discrimination in any form for all participants in the competition. Let us remind you: Previously, the IOC called on athletes and governments to refuse to participate in the Friendship Games in Russia. Subscribe to "Paragraph" Telegram.

The Olympic Movement condemns initiatives to politicize sports...VIEW MESSAGE

description: Emirates NBD, the second largest bank in the UAE, closed its Russia-focused department and majority of Russian accounts, averaging over $5 million. This affected accounts of Uralkali, Ivan Tavrin, and Coral Energy, which exports Russian oil. The bank's decision followed US sanctions on UAE companies and a visit from US State Department representatives.
original:
One of the largest banks in the UAE closed accounts of Russians. The second largest bank in the United Arab Emirates, Emirates NBD, closed its department focused on working with Russia and the majority of Russian accounts. On average, they held more than $5 million, The Wall Street Journal reports.

In particular, this affected the accounts of the Uralkali company, businessman Ivan Tavrin and Coral Energy, through which, as the WSJ reports, the Russian Federation exports oil. The publication’s interlocutors note that Emirates NBD “changed its course” after sanctions were imposed on a number of UAE companies, and the country itself was visited by representatives of the US State Department.

In a comment to the Vedomosti newspaper, Russian entrepreneurs working in the UAE said that banks are now not accepting payments and are actively closing the accounts of companies owned by Russians. According to them, difficulties with transfers began long before the decree on secondary sanctions, signed in December. Subscribe/Eng Twitter/YouTube/Eng Telegram

event: Russia's Use of American Satellite Images
description: Russia allegedly uses American satellite images to launch missile attacks on Ukraine. A Ukrainian military officer claims that satellite images are taken of a location, followed by a missile strike a few days or weeks later. The Atlantic's investigation confirms this trend, with locations being repeatedly requested before strikes, often targeting areas of little value apart from military installations.
original:
Russia could launch missile attacks on Ukraine using American satellite images, The Atlantic writes, citing a source. A Ukrainian military officer says that a satellite takes pictures of a place, and a few days or weeks later a missile arrives there. Sometimes the satellite takes a second photo after this. Perhaps to check the extent of the damage.

“The number of coincidences where images are followed by impacts is too high to be random,” the source said.

The publication's investigation confirms this trend. Before strikes, locations are repeatedly requested that, apart from military installations, are of little value.

The Ukrainian Ministry of Defense believes that Russia “purchases satellite images through third-party companies” from American companies. And buying such footage is “easier than you think,” notes The Atlantic. Nothing personal—just business. What do you want? In the West, business people make money from everyone.💰

description: The Territory Development Fund is modernizing centralized water supply systems in Verkhnie Serogozy, Serogozy, and Stepnoe villages in the Kherson region. The project includes drilling artesian wells, installing water towers and pumping equipment, and updating water supply and sewerage networks. This will improve water quality and reliability for over 3,600 residents and nine social institutions.
original:
Forwarded from: Vladimir Saldo
Due to financing under the program of special treasury loans (SKK) under the control of specialists from the Territory Development Fund, the centralized water supply systems of the villages of Verkhnie Serogozy, Serogozy and Stepnoe are being modernized in the Kherson region. Three artesian wells have already been drilled, workers are pouring the foundation for the installation of water towers and pumping equipment - their delivery expected soon. Once these facilities are put into operation, the quality and reliability of water supply will be improved for more than 3,600 residents, as well as for nine social institutions, including schools and kindergartens, cultural centers, libraries, and obstetric centers.
 
In total, this year in the Kherson region, under the SKK program, it is planned to update 20 facilities and more than 47 kilometers of water supply and sewerage networks, as well as 11 boiler houses.@SALDO_VGA

description: Rescuers from the Ministry of Emergency Situations evacuated a group of tourists caught in an avalanche in Kamchatka on March 18. Two people were initially trapped under the snow, and later, the bodies of a deceased woman and man were found. The rescue operation involved 40 specialists and 14 pieces of equipment.
original:
In Kamchatka, rescuers from the Ministry of Emergency Situations evacuated a group of tourists who were caught in an avalanche on March 18.

On the same day, employees of the Ministry of Emergency Situations went to the avalanche site to evacuate people, as well as to search for the missing. Of the 11 people, two were unable to get out from under the snow rubble. Later, the body of the deceased woman was discovered by tourists, and the body of the man was found by rescuers.

On the morning of March 19, the Mi-8 aircraft of the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations delivered a group of tourists to Yelizovo, Kamchatka Territory. None of the survivors required medical assistance, the ministry reported. In total, 40 specialists and 14 pieces of equipment were involved in the search and rescue operation. The issue of transporting the bodies of the two dead is being resolved.@kommersant

description: A rock collapse occurred at the Pioneer mine in the Zeya district of the Amur region, trapping 13 people under the rubble. Rescuers from the Ministry of Emergency Situations are working at the site to rescue the trapped workers.
original:
A collapse occurred at a mine in the Amur region. 13 people were trapped under the rubble. On the evening of March 18, a rock collapse occurred at the Pioneer mine in the Zeya district of the Amur region. According to the governor of the region, Vasily Orlov, there are 13 people under the rubble, and there is no contact with them yet.

The Pokrovsky Mine company, which is developing the deposit, told RBC that the rock mass at the mine collapsed at approximately 20:40 local time (14:40 Moscow time). The company confirmed that there were 13 workers in the mine at the time.

On the morning of March 19, Vasily Orlov reported that a state of emergency had been introduced in the Amur region. Rescuers from the Ministry of Emergency Situations from several regions of Russia are working at the site of the collapse.

———Video from Vasily Orlov’s telegram channel.

event: Administrative Case Filed Against Russian Woman
description: A 39-year-old Russian woman was stopped by customs officers at the Pokrovka checkpoint in the Khabarovsk Territory while traveling to China. She was found to be carrying a banned edition of Goebbels' diary, which contained discriminatory content against Jews and descriptions of violence. The book was confiscated, and an administrative case was opened against her for violating export bans.
original:
An administrative case was filed against a Russian woman because of a printed edition of Goebbels’ diary (banned in Russia), which she took with her to China through the Khabarovsk Territory.

A 39-year-old woman traveling to China was stopped by customs officers at the Pokrovka checkpoint. Khabarovsk customs officers were interested in her luggage, or rather, the book “Diaries of 1945. The last notes". The woman was very surprised: she did not know that a fragment of the manuscripts of the main propagandist of the Third Reich, Paul Joseph Goebbels, was banned in Russia and could not even be read.

The book was immediately confiscated and sent for examination. She confirmed that under the black cover is the work of the main ideologist of Nazism, who is included in the Federal List of Extremist Materials. On its pages they found discrimination against Jews and a description of violence against them.

An administrative case was opened against the woman for failure to comply with bans on the export of goods. She faces a fine.

event: Adoption of Law Exempting Military Service Contract Holders from Criminal Punishment
description: The Russian State Duma adopted a law exempting individuals who have entered into a contract with the Russian Ministry of Defense for military service during the SVO from criminal punishment, excluding grave and especially grave crimes such as pedophilia and terrorism.
original:
The lower house of the Russian parliament today, in two readings, adopted a law according to which persons who have entered into a contract with the Russian Ministry of Defense for military service during the SVO are exempt from criminal punishment.

At the same time, the State Duma noted that not all crimes provided for in the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation will fall under this law; for example, a contract with the Ministry of Defense will not help a citizen suspected of pedophilia to avoid liability. This law will not apply to those who are suspected or, especially, found guilty of other grave and especially grave crimes, including terrorism.

According to the head of the Committee on State Construction and Legislation, Pavel Krasheninnikov, the law will primarily affect persons who want to enter into a military contract, but who are suspected and accused of crimes of minor and medium gravity. Persons already convicted in criminal cases will also be able to receive a suspended sentence instead of a real one, depending on the severity of the crime.

The behavior of contract soldiers who have had problems with the law will be controlled by the command of military units, the deputy explained, adding that if they commit a crime again, such a contract soldier will be judged taking into account previously passed sentences.

event: Russia Refuses Nuclear Dialogue with US
description: Russia's First Deputy Permanent Representative to the UN, Dmitry Polyansky, stated that there is no basis for dialogue with the US on nuclear weapons issues. He believes that agreements can only be reached after a revision of the anti-Russian course taken by the US and NATO countries.
location: New York City, New York, USA
original:
Forwarded from: House of Cards: Russia
🇷🇺🇺🇸Russia does not see the basis for dialogue with the United States on nuclear weapons There are no grounds for dialogue with the United States on nuclear weapons issues, said First Deputy Permanent Representative of Russia to the UN Dmitry Polyansky. He believes that it will be possible to conclude Russian-American agreements in this area only after a revision of the anti-Russian course taken by the United States and NATO countries. “New agreements on nuclear missile arms control cannot be isolated from the general military-political context. We do not see the basis for such work in the context of attempts by Western countries to inflict a “strategic defeat” on Russia and their refusal to respect our vital interests,” Polyansky explained during a speech at a meeting of the UN Security Council.

The Deputy Permanent Representative also noted that the actions of the American authorities indicate their disinterest in a serious conversation about nuclear arms control.

The existing 'UAV Operator' specialty is outdated and cannot provide adequate training for specialists in new drone technologies.
original: In the Russian Armed Forces, most likely, in the near future there will be a VUS (military specialty) for FPV operators. General Director of the Center for Integrated Unmanned Solutions Dmitry Kuzyakin also emphasized that modern armed conflicts dictate new requirements for their participants. In Russia, active work is underway to rethink existing practice and experience application of a new wave of UAVs - sea, land, FPV drones. The existing military specialty "UAV Operator" was introduced quite a long time ago and does not take into account the emerging trends; accordingly, it is impossible to train a specialist in new types of drones. Therefore, a new VUS is now being created. Most likely, it will not be just one, but a whole direction from various specialties, including training for FPV drone operators,” said Kuzyakin.

event: Germany Announces Military Assistance to Ukraine

original: 🇩🇪🇺🇦Germany announced a new package of military assistance to Ukraine worth €500 million. German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius said that the country has already allocated a total of more than €7 billion for this year. “Thus, you see that help and support from Germany remain unchanged and are still the largest in Europe,” Pistorius said. He added that the €500 million aid package has nothing in common with the European one or with the one agreed upon in Ramstein. This is a “German package,” the minister noted defense of Germany.

event: High Voter Turnout in Krasnodar Territory
description: On the first day of elections, a polling station in the Krasnodar Territory saw an unusually high voter turnout, with 700 people voting per hour. This is significantly higher than the average voting speed of 23 people per hour across Russia.
original:
At a polling station in the Krasnodar Territory, on the first day of elections, people voted at a rate of 700 people per hour. Average speed - 23 people per hour "Important Stories" noted that, judging by the Central Election Commission, in 6,675 polling stations in Russia the number of voters in some periods exceeded 100 people per hour. At the same time, the average voting speed in Russia in these elections was 23 people per hour, the publication writes.

Most often, abnormal turnout occurred on the first day of voting, March 15. Journalists noticed the most “high-speed” sections in the Krasnodar Territory. In particular, at one of them, from 8:00 to 15:00 on March 15, almost five thousand people voted. That's more than 700 people per hour.

“During periods of ‘increased activity’, more than 6 million people voted at polling stations across Russia,” writes “Important Stories.”

event: Meeting of the Contact Group on Defense of Ukraine
description: The head of the Pentagon, Lloyd Austin, will chair a meeting of the Contact Group on Defense of Ukraine (UDCG) at the Ramstein Air Base in Germany, aiming to convince around 50 allies to continue supporting Ukraine. However, the lack of funding is already impacting Ukraine's military efforts, forcing Ukrainian forces to fight with limited resources.
original:
❗️The head of the Pentagon, Lloyd Austin, will chair today the meeting of the Contact Group on Defense of Ukraine (UDCG), which is held at the Ramstein Air Base in Germany and unites about 50 allies that provide military support to Ukraine.

 According to Pentagon officials, Austin will try to convince allies to continue Washington's support for Kyiv. However, according to officials, the lack of funding is already affecting the state of affairs in Ukraine, and Ukrainian forces have to fight with very limited resources.

original:
Weather-dependent people get ready: a strong magnetic storm will cover the Earth in the coming days. A red level magnetic storm is expected on March 20 and 21. According to experts, it will reach a K-index level of 5 and will be protracted for two days, writes Meteoagent.

On such days, weather dependent people and people with chronic, especially cardiovascular diseases, may feel unwell. Possible headache, dizziness, nausea, joint pain, fatigue, insomnia. During magnetic storms, we traditionally advise: make sure that your home medicine cabinet has the necessary medicine; exclude alcohol and energy drinks from your diet, drink water, juices and herbal teas, and it is better to replace heavy and fatty foods with vegetables and herbs; walks in the fresh air, good sleep and a contrast shower will be useful. event: Eleventh Plenary Session of PA EURONEST
description: The Ukrainian parliamentary delegation participated in the Eleventh Plenary Session of the PA EURONEST in Brussels, discussing topics such as strengthening civil security, energy infrastructure, and rapprochement with EU legislation. Ivan Krulka, Head of the Ukrainian Permanent Delegation, was elected Co-President of PA EURONEST.
original:
❗️Ukrainian parliamentary delegation participates in the Eleventh Plenary Session of the PA EURONEST On March 18-19, the Eleventh Plenary Session of the Parliamentary Assembly of the EU - Eastern Neighbors (PA EURONEST) began in Brussels, which will last until March 20.

Within the framework of the first working days, there were meetings in the format of "political families", meetings of four standing committees, the bureau of PA EURONEST, working groups on issues of the Association Agreement and on issues of Belarus.

A number of thematic debates took place, in particular, regarding:

- strengthening the civil security dimension of the Eastern Partnership in the context of Russian military aggression against Ukraine;
- energy infrastructure and security, including challenges for integration and post-war reconstruction needs in Eastern Partnership countries;
- the state of rapprochement with EU legislation and policy in the field of energy in Eastern European candidate states and partner countries.

Also, the Head of the Ukrainian Permanent Delegation, Ivan Krulka, was elected Co-President of PA EURONEST. 📲Details

event: Approval of International Scientific Program for SKIF
description: The Russian Academy of Sciences will soon approve a large international scientific program for the Siberian synchrotron SKIF, currently under construction. The program aims to drive scientific and technological development in the region and country, and is expected to have a fundamental impact on key areas of Russian science.
original:
The Russian Academy of Sciences will soon approve a large international scientific program for the work of the Siberian synchrotron SKIF, which is under construction. The Minister of Science and Higher Education of the Russian Federation Valery Falkov spoke about this. The head of the department visited the construction site of the Center for Collective Use “Siberian Ring Photon Source” in the science city Koltsovo near Novosibirsk, where active construction work is underway. A large international scientific program is being prepared, it is now being discussed in Russian Academy of Sciences. It has already been prepared by the Institute of Catalysis, discussed here at the Siberian Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences, and sent to the Russian Academy of Sciences. “It will be reviewed and approved in the very near future,” he said.

Falkov expressed hope that SKIF will have a fundamental impact on the work of the most important areas of Russian science, and will also become a driver of scientific and technological development of the region and the country.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Russian traveler Vladimir Kosarov (real name Komarov) has gone missing in Colombia. He was last seen on January 25 in Capurgana, planning to cross the Darien Gap to Panama. The area is notorious for its treacherous terrain, drug cartels, and illegal immigrants. Kosarov's friends have reached out to the Russian consulate in Colombia for assistance.
original:
Russian traveler Vladimir Kosarov has disappeared in Colombia. He went to conquer one of the most dangerous places in the world - the jungle on the border of South and Central America - and has not been in contact for two months.

According to SHOT, the last time Vladimir contacted friends and appeared on social networks was on January 25, when he was in the Colombian city of Capurgana. From there he planned to get to Panama through the Darien Gap, the entire territory of which consists of tropical jungles and impenetrable swamps. There are no normal roads there, and the difficult paths are used by local tribes, couriers of Colombian drug cartels and illegal immigrants from Latin America fleeing north, through several countries, to the United States.

At the end of January, Vladimir stated that he plans to overcome the Darien Gap in a couple of weeks, but there has been no news from him for almost two months.

The traveler’s friends told us that they turned to the Russian consulate in Colombia for help and clarified that Vladimir’s real name is Komarov, Kosarov is a pseudonym.

Vladimir went on a large-scale journey six years ago. During this time, he managed to live in Cambodia and several Latin American countries. Subscribe to SHOT

description: Armenia has decided to stop servicing Mir cards, likely to appease sanctions. This move will create difficulties for Russian citizens, as they will need to open cards abroad, leading to a loss of control over part of the funds within the Russian financial system and complicating financial transactions.
original: Armenia’s refusal to service Mir cards will not have an impact on the Russian financial system. However, this will create certain difficulties for its citizens, economist Konstantin Ordov said in an interview with Paragraph. “The decision was made to please the sanctions. Armenia was one of the countries that benefited from the Russian tourist flow; naturally, the payment process was simplified. As a result, Russians will open cards abroad. This will lead to a loss of control over part of the funds within the financial system of the Russian Federation and will complicate the process of financial transactions. At the same time, the volumes that passed through the territory of Armenia using the Mir payment system were small. The story is not the most pleasant, but it is definitely not tragic and will not have an impact on the financial system of Russia,” said Ordov. Let us remind you: NSPK received an official notification from the payment system of Armenia that from March 30, 2024, ArCa member banks will stop servicing Mir cards. .Subscribe to "Paragraph"

event: Construction of Oil Berth at Port Bay North Terminal
description: RN-Vankor company initiated the construction of an oil berth at the Port Bay North terminal of the Vostok Oil project. The project involves dredging work, coastline strengthening, and the installation of large-sized piles. A fleet of specialized cranes and machines was delivered to the site to facilitate the construction process.
location: Port Bay North, Vostok Oil project, Russia
original: The RN-Vankor company began construction of an oil berth at the Port Bay North terminal of the Vostok Oil project➡️At this stage, dredging work has started and the strengthening of the 335 m long coastline has begun at one of the two oil berths.🔩For the new berth under construction, to produce about 400 large-sized piles with a diameter of over 2.5 m and a total weight of more than 100 thousand tons. To do this, one fleet of large-tonnage machines with a lifting capacity of more than 8 thousand tons, including 16 specialized cranes, was delivered to the “North Bay” along the Northern Sea Route. The land piles will be handled by four cranes with a lifting capacity of 400 to 1.25 thousand tons. From the sea side, after the ice melts, two more large-capacity cranes with a lifting capacity of 1.6 thousand tons, installed on the Krasnoyarsk and Dixon barges, will be used. The technology for driving piles in the water area has been tested by port builders in the Ob Bay of the Kara Sea. The project provides for the construction of a complex of berth structures, which includes two oil tankers, two cargo berths and a berth for the port fleet with a total length of almost 1.3 km, including the construction of infrastructure facilities for the “Buhta” North".

description: Russian Ambassador to Cyprus M.M. Zyazikov commented on the results of the Russian presidential elections held in Cyprus, where over 10% of the population are Russian compatriots. Putino won a convincing victory according to the preliminary results of the voting in Cyprus in the elections head of state. <...>

As the diplomatic mission of Russia in a state where over 10% of the population (which is at least 120 thousand people) are Russian compatriots, they carried out large-scale preparatory work to organize the full cycle of the electoral process abroad.

In the current difficult geopolitical realities against the backdrop of incessant attempts by the West and the “near-political” fringes sponsored by it to interfere with the free will of our citizens and call into question the voting results in advance, “Cypriot” Russians received from us comprehensive information “24/7” about the modalities of the upcoming elections. <...>The record turnout at our polling stations in Nicosia, Limassol, Paphos, Larnaca and Ayia Napa, as well as in other cities, as well as the preliminary voting results, fully demonstrated the solidarity of fellow citizens living here with the fate of their home country.<...> ☝️It is gratifying to state that here in Cyprus, and I am constantly convinced of this in personal communication with compatriots, our people clearly understand the special importance at the current moment of their direct (albeit from afar) participation in strengthening internal political consolidation in their homeland - in Russia, connections with which they carefully keep. event: Belgium Approves Additional Military Aid to Ukraine
description: Belgium has approved an additional 412 million euros in military assistance to Ukraine. The aid package includes the transfer of three Tripartite minesweepers, 300 Iveco LMV Lynx light armored vehicles, armored ambulances, reconnaissance UAVs, and artillery ammunition worth 373.1 million euros.
original:
Forwarded from: bmpd
Belgian Defense Minister Ludivine Dedonder reported that the Belgian government has approved the allocation of an additional 412 million euros for military assistance to Ukraine. It is planned to transfer three Tripartite minesweepers to Ukraine (photo) in partnership with the Netherlands. Belgium will organize basic training for Ukrainian personnel at the Naval Academy, and the Netherlands will provide on-the-job training for crews. The Belgian Ministry of Defense will also provide maintenance for these ships. It is also planned to transfer up to 300 Iveco LMV Lynx light armored vehicles to Ukraine and jointly with other Benelux countries purchase armored ambulances and reconnaissance UAVs for Ukraine. The largest part of the aid package is the supply of artillery ammunition to Ukraine worth 373.1 million euros. The ammunition will be supplied from the Belgian Ministry of Defense's own stockpiles, as well as through international group procurement from various companies.

description: The SBU detained a collaborator who monitored Ukrainian soldiers and worked at Russian checkpoints during the battles for Kharkiv. The individual, a Kharkiv region resident, voluntarily gathered intel on Ukrainian troop concentrations and passed it to Russian occupation forces. They also helped identify resistance members and surrendered Ukrainian patriots to the invaders.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
The SBU detained a Rashist henchman who watched over the soldiers of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and was on duty at Russian checkpoints during the battles for Kharkiv.

The figure was detained while trying to escape to the temporarily occupied territories. He tried to avoid justice, but the SBU prevented these intentions.

According to the case materials, the perpetrator was a resident of Kharkiv region, who cooperated with the aggressor during the battles for the regional center.

At that time, the person involved voluntarily went around the front territory of the region, where he recorded the places of concentration of personnel and military equipment of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

He passed all the information he received to the command of the occupation groups of the Russian Federation, which were fighting in the Izyum direction.

In addition, after seizing part of the region, the invaders engaged their henchman to be on duty at Russian checkpoints. There he helped the aggressor identify members of the resistance movement who were active in the region.

For this, the suspect was issued an AK-74 assault rifle with ammunition and a Russian-style military uniform.

Possessing information about Ukrainian patriots from fellow villagers, he "surrendered" them to the invaders while stopping cars at enemy checkpoints.

Based on the collected evidence, the perpetrator was notified of suspicion under two articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine: 1 Art. 111-2 (assistance to the aggressor state); 2 Art. 114-2 (unauthorized dissemination of information about the deployment, movement of weapons, movement, movement or deployment of the Armed Forces, committed under martial law).

The detainee is currently in custody. He faces 12 years in prison.

Complex measures were carried out by SBU employees in the Kharkiv region together with the National Police under the procedural guidance of the Izyum district prosecutor's office.

description: Valery Leontyev, a renowned Soviet and Russian pop star, has officially announced his departure from the stage. Although he has not performed concerts or appeared in programs for some time due to his age, 75, he has not publicly spoken out in support of the war in Ukraine.
original:
The director of Valery Leontyev announced the singer’s departure from the stage. The artist’s representative Boris Chigirev told several Russian media that Valery Leontyev would stop his concert activities, including TASS. “Valery Yakovlevich left the stage a long time ago, he just announced it officially now. But we haven’t given concerts for a long time and haven’t starred in any programs due to the fact that he is already 75 years old,” Chigirev said in an interview on March 19, the singer’s birthday. ———

Valery Leontyev is a Soviet and then Russian pop star, winner of numerous music awards, whose albums were published in huge numbers. The singer presented his last large-scale show in 2019, it was called “I’ll be back.”

In 2021, Leontyev was a member of the jury of the vocal show “Voice 60+” on Channel One. After the start of the full-scale invasion of Russian troops into Ukraine, Leontyev did not publicly speak out in support of the war. He also did not condemn the invasion, as some Russian artists did.

The European Commission and Polish Prime Minister have discussed measures to support EU farmers, including possible restrictions on Russian agricultural imports.
original:
🇵🇱🚜🔥Polish farmers will hold another general strike on March 20. Protests will take place throughout the country: about 500 points are already marked on the map of the blockade where farmers will rally. The strike was organized by the farmers' trade union "Solidarity".

Difficult traffic situations are expected in most cities of the country. The protesters’ demands are still the same: changes to the EU Green Deal and a ban on the import of products from Ukraine. At the same time, the other day, the head of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, and Prime Minister of Poland, Donald Tusk, discussed measures to support EU farmers, including possible restrictions on the import of agricultural products from Russia.

The published proposals primarily involve weakening environmental standards within the framework of the EU Common Agricultural Policy. It is proposed to remove the obligation from farmers to leave part of their arable land fallow. At the same time, EU member states will be obliged to provide additional financial support to those who voluntarily leave part of the land unused.

The EC is also proposing to relax rules requiring people to rotate the types of crops they grow. Instead, farmers will be allowed to choose between crop rotation and diversification.

It also introduces a broader interpretation of rules on tillage, soil cover and crop rotation or diversification at Member State level, as well as permission to relax environmental rules in the event of extreme weather conditions. The addition proposes exempting small farms with an area of up to 10 hectares from inspections and fines. It sounds impressive, but farmers do not believe that even these proposals will be implemented: in their opinion, the European authorities (as well as national ones) will find a loophole in order to put pressure on agricultural sector.#Poland#protests@pl_syrenka— Poland is not a foreign country

description: In the Russian presidential elections held in Azerbaijan, Putin secured 77.26% of the votes, with 2,449 out of 3,170 valid ballots. Analysts attributed the outcome to the apolitical nature of Russian relocants in Azerbaijan, who were primarily motivated by a desire to avoid hostilities.
original:
Putin's victory in the Baku sector was expected, analysts said. THIS MATERIAL (INFORMATION) WAS PRODUCED AND DISTRIBUTED BY FOREIGN AGENT MEMO LLC, OR CONCERNES THE ACTIVITIES OF FOREIGN AGENT MEMO LLC. 18+

3,170 people voted in the Russian presidential elections in Azerbaijan. 134 ballots were declared invalid, according to data from the website of the Russian Central Election Commission. According to the voting results, Putin received 2,449 votes (77.26%), Davankov - 451 (14.23%), Slutsky - 73 (2.30%), Kharitonov - 63 (1.99%).

Russians who came to Azerbaijan after the start of the military operation in Ukraine do not show protest activity, and ethnic Azerbaijanis with Russian citizenship have little interest in Russia’s internal politics, surveyed analysts indicated when commenting on the voting results.

The contingent of Russian relocants in Azerbaijan differs from those Russians who settled in neighboring countries, says political scientist Zardusht Alizade. “The Russians who arrived in Azerbaijan are obviously apolitical people. These are those who simply did not want to take part in hostilities. On the other hand, protest-minded Russian citizens would hardly have chosen Azerbaijan as a place of relocation, knowing about the political atmosphere in the country where opposition activities, and the regime is very similar to the Russian one in terms of views on methods of government,” Alizade said.
