event: Acid Attack on Woman and Daughter
description: A man poured acid on his wife and 7-year-old daughter, leaving them with severe burns. The woman was hospitalized in critical condition and remains in a coma. The mother and daughter require financial assistance for medical treatment, including operations, and basic necessities like a sofa, bedding, and personal care items.
original:
18+ A man poured acid on his wife and daughter (photo) A woman and her 7-year-old daughter were hospitalized with serious burns after the woman’s husband and the girl’s father poured acid on them.

The woman was hospitalized in extremely serious condition and was in a coma for several days. Co-founder of the “Ask a Mom” project, Christina Mastak-Komerzan, reported this incident on her social network page.

She wrote a post informing the public that the mother and daughter needed help, particularly financial.

- Burns to the bones... She has already undergone several operations. And that is not all…

Mom begs us to be with them. There is no one who can help them!

From the basics they need:

- A sofa that folds out. The bed they slept on was completely burned by acid. Including sheets, pillows, duvets.

- Silicone creams/compresses/foams for scars.

- Diapers for adults M, disposable diapers.

- Protein and vitamin supplements. The woman is very weak.

God, I have so much anger and hatred at how unprotected and vulnerable the women of our country are. My heart breaks with despair and pain when I imagine what trials this mother and her little girl have gone through and are going through,” Christina wrote.

Police representatives have not yet responded whether they were informed about this case. Notebook Moldova Notebook Moldova18+ A man poured acid on his wife and daughter (photo) Not recommended for the faint of heart

original:
The Australian ABC channel made a film about the occupiers.

He called it "The Other Side".

Our ambassador Vasyl Miroshnychenko called it "a bowl of vomit".

"The tape spreads outright lies, racist statements and propaganda narratives coming from the Kremlin," the Ukrainian Embassy in Australia said.

The television company answers something sluggishly about a "new look" and "two sides".

I will express my opinion.

There is only one thing behind the choice of topics and locations. Searching for an exclusive. And for the company. And for a particular journalist, who excuses himself in a pleasant baritone that "there is no way back."

They don't care that this "exclusive" works for absolute evil.

They are interested in our war only from the point of view of ratings.

And the Kremlin uses this. I will not be surprised if, in addition to the "green light" for shooting, the guests were "warmed up" with something more substantial.

The Kremlin spends an insane amount of money and resources to promote its narratives in the West.

I say again that we need to find an opportunity to make an informational and artistic product for a Western audience.

event: Death Threats Against Miss School Winner
description: A 15-year-old ninth-grader, Sveta, won the Miss School competition at school No. 1371 in Moscow. However, she received death threats from another participant and her friends, who created a Telegram group to harass her, posting her address and promising to kill her. The offenders were found and claimed they were just joking, but Sveta's parents refused to withdraw the police statement.
original:
#fucked up_broadcasts
A ninth-grader from Moscow received death threats for winning the Miss School competition. The teenagers created the group “Svetka fucker”, published her address and promised to kill her.
Show more
Recently, a beauty contest among girls was held at school No. 1371. One of the participants was 15-year-old Sveta (name changed), a 9th grade student. According to her father, the schoolgirl was nominated because she is a prefect, an excellent student and a volunteer.
Sveta won, and the next day she was showered with insults from another participant in the competition: the girl asked how much the winner paid for first place and criticized her appearance. Sveta didn’t answer, she just complained to her mom about the messages and went to bed.
In the morning, she saw a bunch of threats on her phone from the same girl and her friends. They created a group on Telegram, in which they threw mud at the winner and posted her address, right down to her apartment. She was told to “count the minutes until death” and promised to kill her. At this point Sveta got scared and sent screenshots to her parents.
Because of the threats, the schoolgirl's father wrote a statement to the police. The girls were quickly found; they turned out to be students of the same school. In their defense, they said that they were just joking. Sveta’s parents were asked to withdraw the statement, but they refused because their daughter’s offenders did not even apologize.

original: Russia does not see the basis for a dialogue with the United States on nuclear weapons, said First Deputy Permanent Representative of the Russian Federation to the UN Dmitry Polyansky. He believes that the conclusion of any new agreements in this area with the Americans is possible only after the US and NATO revise their anti-Russian course. “New agreements on nuclear missile arms control cannot be isolated from the general military-political context. We do not see the basis for such work in the context of attempts by Western countries to inflict a “strategic defeat” on Russia and their refusal to respect our vital interests,” Polyansky explained during a speech at a meeting of the UN Security Council. He also noted that the actions of the United States indicate their lack of interest in a serious conversation about nuclear arms control. And “hysterics and threats from Washington, London and Brussels” do not impress Russia. Subscribe to Zvezdanews|Suggest news

event: Drone Attack on Zaporozhye Nuclear Power Plant
description: The IAEA released a statement about a drone attack on the Zaporozhye nuclear power plant, but did not attribute the attack to any party. Russia's Permanent Representative to international organizations in Vienna, M.I. Ulyanov, criticized the IAEA's approach, citing a previous commitment by the IAEA Director General to publicly condemn any attacks on the plant.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian Mission Vienna
🇷🇺Comment by the Permanent Representative of the Russian Federation to international organizations in Vienna M.I. Ulyanov to the TASS news agency❓The IAEA released a statement about the drone attack against the Zaporozhye nuclear power plant, but did not name the guilty party, despite calls from Russia. What is the reason for this policy of the Organization? Can we expect the Agency to change its approach in this matter? The IAEA refers to the fact that the Agency's Statute does not provide for the Secretariat to perform attributive functions, that is, the functions of determining the guilty country. Here, however, there is one fundamental exception. On May 30, 2023, after lengthy consultations with Moscow and Kiev, IAEA Director General Rafael Grossi announced at the UN Security Council “five specific principles” for ensuring safety at the Zaporozhye NPP. The most important of them is the inadmissibility of attacks on the station. R. Grossi pledged, if an attack on the Zaporizhia NPP does occur, to immediately make this fact public in the public space. Thank God, since November 20, 2022, there have been no Ukrainian strikes directly on the territory of the plant❓Does the Russian side agree with the conclusions of experts that the strike did not affect the nuclear safety of the Zaporizhia NPP, as well as with the conclusions that the exact nature of the strike (drone or other projectile) ) cannot be established?💬The corresponding section of the statement published by the IAEA causes, to say the least, bewilderment and disappointment. The emphasis in this message is placed in some bizarre way. Indeed, the drone attack in the immediate vicinity of a diesel fuel storage facility fortunately did not lead to negative consequences for nuclear safety, but it did create an extremely serious threat. The vapors released by diesel fuel are explosive. Taking into account the huge reserves of diesel in the storage facilities adjacent to the Zaporizhia NPP, the consequences could be catastrophic. This fundamental aspect was completely ignored by the Agency Secretariat, as if it were completely indifferent to it. The experts’ statement that they were unable to determine the origin of the crater they saw five meters from the fence of the diesel fuel storage facility also sounded absurd. From the point of view of nuclear safety and the IAEA mandate, it makes no difference whether the crater was the result of a drone explosion or some other explosive device. The very fact of delivering a strike close to a vital facility on the territory of an industrial zone adjacent to the perimeter of the Zaporozhye NPP is important. In addition to the risk of fire and explosion, it should be borne in mind that reserve diesel fuel reserves are extremely important to ensure guaranteed power supply to the station in the event of power line failure. The drafters of the document in the Agency Secretariat demonstrated a completely detached attitude towards this, limiting themselves to a dry presentation of the facts. We brought our critical comments to the attention of the Secretariat. We emphasized that we henceforth expect more verified and objective assessments from Agency employees at the Zaporozhye NPP and the IAEA headquarters in Vienna. TelegramRussian Mission Vienna MediaVIEW MESSAGE

description: A rock collapse in a mine shaft in the Amur Region has trapped miners, prompting a criminal investigation. It is reported that the investigation team is inspecting the scene of the incident, interrogating eyewitnesses of the incident and seizing documentation, while rescuers continue to work to locate and raise the victims to the surface.

As of today, up to 13 people may be under the rubble. 25 rescuers and four special equipment came to their aid. It is reported that rescuers heard impacts on the ventilation pipe from the lower levels of the mine - this may mean that there are living people below. If a violation of safety requirements during work is discovered, the managers of the contracting organization face a prison sentence or a fine.

description: The Directorate for Migration Issues of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for the Zaporozhye region presented passports to 14-year-old orphaned residents of Melitopol. The event emphasized the responsibility that comes with obtaining a passport and encouraged the children to be worthy citizens of Russia.
original:
In the Directorate for Migration Issues of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for the Zaporozhye region, a ceremonial presentation of passports to 14-year-old residents of Melitopol who were left without parental care took place.

The main document of a Russian citizen was presented to the children by the Deputy Head of the Directorate for Migration Issues of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for the Zaporozhye Region, Police Colonel Leonid Panyushkin. Addressing the event participants, he noted that obtaining a passport is, first of all, a great responsibility, and wished to be worthy citizens of the Great Country.

The Migration Department has been interacting with the Melitopol Regional Center for Social and Psychological Rehabilitation of Children since March 2023, and during this time 17 pupils of the Center were awarded passports.

Having received the document, the young residents of Melitopol thanked the police for the quick processing of passports and promised to bear the title of citizen of our Motherland with honor.

After all, they said that no one has the right to invade the borders of another state? But no, this was remembered only when Russia invaded Ukraine,” the historian said. description: The trawler Captain Lobanov sank in the Baltic Sea, likely due to an explosion on board. The incident occurred in a 10-mile zone off the coast of the Kaliningrad region. original:
The trawler "Captain Lobanov" sank in the Baltic Sea. Preliminarily, due to an explosion on board.

According to preliminary information, the explosion occurred in the Baltic Sea in a 10-mile zone, not far from the coast of the Kaliningrad region. At about 11 a.m. the ship sent out a distress signal.

There were 7 crew members on board the trawler, four were injured. At least one person was killed, sources said. The causes of the explosion are unknown.

This is not the first time that the “Captain Lobanov” has sunk - in 2021, the fishing vessel fell on its side while being launched, after which it partially sank. No one was hurt then.

Then they were appointed to various "positions" as part of the Berdian, Melitopol, Vasyliv and Yakymiv "departments" of the punitive body of the aggressor country.

Being in the ranks of the occupying "branch of the Ministry of the Interior of the Russian Federation", those involved take part in mass repressions against local residents.
For this purpose, criminals fabricate "cases" against Ukrainian patriots. And then they are kidnapped from their own homes or right in the middle of the street and imprisoned in Russian torture camps.
During such "raids", collaborators rob victims' homes under the guise of "searches".

On the basis of the collected evidence, the investigators of the Security Service informed the defendants of suspicion under Part 7 of Art. 111-1 (collaborative activity) of the Criminal Code of Ukraine.

event: EU Prepares to Introduce Duties on Grain Imports
description: The EU is planning to introduce duties on grain imports from Russia and Belarus due to large-scale protests by farmers in member states. The duties, set at €95 per ton of grain and 50% for oilseeds and their processed products, aim to reduce demand and protect EU farmers.
original: Monkey's work: The EU is preparing to introduce duties on grain imports from Russia and Belarus.🔹This is due to large-scale protests by farmers in member states. Polish farmers, for example, are still blocking the border crossing with Ukraine for agricultural goods imported into the EU. Grain producers are annoyed not only by the special conditions for Ukrainian grain (despite the fact that Kiev is not a member of the European Union), but also by the “green” policy, which makes their products uncompetitive even within the bloc, not to mention the world market.🔹On Friday, Ursula von der Leyen made a statement , which “assesses the possibility of introducing sanctions on the import of agricultural products from Russia.” But, most likely, duties will be chosen, since this does not require unanimous approval of EU members, and the possibility of transit of Russian grain will not be closed. Duties will be set at the maximum level allowed by WTO rules: €95 per ton of grain, as well as 50% for oilseeds and their processed products. According to experts, this should practically destroy demand. By the way, imports of grains, oilseeds and their derivatives into the EU from Russia in 2023 set a record, reaching 1% of total EU consumption.@kstati_p

description: The Minister of Agriculture of the Kherson region, Sanal Adyaev, held a meeting with Alexander Dovbnya, Director of the Federal State Budgetary Institution 'Rosselkhoztsentr' Donetsk, to discuss the registration and certification of seed enterprises in the Kherson region. One of the key issues on the agenda was registration of certification of seed enterprises in the Kherson region. Enterprises that applied for certification received, at the expense of the Federal budget, seed material of flax, varietal and hybrid sunflower for demonstration plots in the Skadovsky, Kakhovsky, Novotroitsky and Genichesk districts. “The production of zoned seeds is the key to the food security of the region,” commented Sanal Adyaev. #Ministry_AIC_Kherson_region @APKKherson

event: All-Russian Public Action 'Volunteer Call for Victory'
description: The 'Veterans of Russia' public movement launched the 'Volunteer Call for Victory' initiative, aiming to increase volunteer recruitment for the Special Military Operation and support President Putin's policies. Regional authorities have expressed support and are providing assistance.
original:
ALL-RUSSIAN PUBLIC ACTION “VOLUNTEER CALL FOR VICTORY”: REGIONS OF RUSSIA JOIN THE INITIATIVE At the beginning of February of this year, the all-Russian public movement “VETERANS OF RUSSIA” came up with a proposal to hold an All-Russian public action “Volunteer Call for Victory”. We turned to the heads of regions with a request to support the initiative, and Russian regions expressed their support for this important measure.

We live in a historical moment when it is necessary to clearly understand who are the enemies of Russia and who stands in the way of its development. Our common task is to ensure the security of the country and preserve national sovereignty. Nothing can be more important than this goal. The main goal of the “Volunteer Call for Victory” action is not only to increase the efficiency of attracting volunteers to the Special Military Operation, but also to create conditions for maximum support for the policies pursued by Russian President Vladimir Putin. Not only veteran organizations are invited to this action, but also regional and local executive authorities of the constituent entities of the Russian Federation. The heads of Russian regions expressed unequivocal support for the initiative and readiness to provide all necessary assistance. Many regions have already joined the action, and their number is growing every day. Today our country is facing an important test, and we are confident that our common Victory is approaching. Our victorious heroes, who have gone through fire and water, will return home to contribute to the further development of Great Russia. Let's support this important initiative and do everything possible to ensure the security of our Motherland! We invite you to join: https://t.me/veterany_60omsb/ 1474@veteranrossii_online

description: Wildberries has introduced new payment rules for pick-up point owners, requiring a minimum rating of 4.9 to receive weekly payments. Failure to meet this condition may result in delayed payments or even point closures. Owners are planning to protest at the Moscow head office and file a complaint with the FAS.
original:
Forwarded from: SHOT CHECK
Wildberries wants to deprive the owners of pick-up points of weekly payments if the rating of their points falls below 4.9. Partners will be able to receive their money only after a month of work with ratings above 4.9. If the point of issue fulfills these conditions, then its owner can return the weekly payments. And if not, then Wildberries may close the point altogether.

The owners of the pickup point, who received chain letters from the company with the new rules, are in shock and are going to attack the Wildberries head office in Moscow, as well as write a collective complaint to the FAS. According to many sellers, with the new rules their business will simply go to zero or become unprofitable.

We recently wrote about OZON pickup points, which closed as a strike due to the company's new service fee.SHOT CHECK Subscribe!

description: During his work, the author came across a unique, undamaged church in Avdeevka, amidst the apocalyptic surroundings. The church showed no signs of direct hits, with its domes and crosses intact. The lack of craters on the territory stood out, especially considering the numerous craters throughout Avdeevka.
original:
Forwarded from: Denis [Z] Grigoryuk
During my work, I came across dozens of destroyed churches that looked, so to speak, in harmony with the apocalyptic surroundings. This temple was not like the ones I had come across before. There were no traces of direct hits on it, the domes survived, and even the crosses on them were in their place. Even on the territory itself there were practically no craters. Considering their number throughout Avdeevka, this fact only emphasized the unreality of what they saw.

My full report from Avdeevka about the guard of the Church of Mary Magdalene can be read at the link: https://asd.news/articles/dnr/predannyy-do-kontsa/

Because all payments have the stamp DSK - "for official use" 🙈Apparently, someone really didn't want inquisitive citizens to be interested in contracts and prices. 👉🏼Who else was paid by the metro for the leadership of Braginsky and how are these companies related to the director himself - in the 2nd part of the investigation of Lesya Ivanova.

event: US Federal Authorities Ban Texas from Arresting Illegal Migrants
description: The Biden administration intervened to prevent Texas from passing a law allowing the detention of suspected illegal migrants. The Supreme Court sided with the White House, temporarily freezing the adoption of the law. The Texas Attorney General argued that the state has the right to protect itself from transnational cartels, deepening the rift between Texas and Washington amid the US migration crisis.
original: US federal authorities have banned Texas from arresting illegal migrants. Previously, state authorities tried to pass a law allowing the detention of people on suspicion of illegal entry into the United States. However, the Biden administration filed an emergency application with the Supreme Court, which sided with the White House and temporarily froze the adoption of the law. If not for Biden's actions, the new Texas law would have already entered into force. At the same time, the Texas Attorney General said that according to the Constitution, the state has the right to protect itself from “cruel transnational cartels.” So the rift between Texas and Washington amid the migration crisis in the United States will continue to grow.

description: Residents of the Grayvoronsky district in the Belgorod region reported a 'very tense situation' due to increased shelling, causing power outages, water supply disruptions, and property damage. Many houses are on fire, and emergency services are delayed or unable to respond. The area is largely deserted, with many residents fleeing their homes.
original:
“They said that the elections would be held and everything would end and calm down. In my opinion, nothing is calming down." Residents of the Grayvoronsky district of the Belgorod region told "Caution, News" about a "very tense situation." Today in Grayvoron, the regional center, the last grocery store has closed. According to locals, due to increased shelling in the region and villages, “the situation is very tense”: electricity has been lost and the water supply has stopped. “We don’t have water or electricity. I charge my phone in the car,” local resident Vladimir (name changed) told Beware News. According to him, not everyone in Grayvoron has cellular communications and the Internet: “the towers were bombed,” only the Tele2 operator works.

The man also noted that because of the shelling, “many houses are on fire” and emergency services sometimes do not arrive at the scene, because “they could arrive at any moment.” According to him, the villages of the Grayvoronsky district were deserted, many people left their homes.

Vladimir remains in the village, fearing looting. According to him, it is also difficult to leave Grayvoron, since civilian and military equipment is sometimes left right on the road, blocking the passage. “Nobody cleaned up the burned truck. The tank was standing in the middle of the road. People can't even leave. Why such an appeal? he asks.

Now Vladimir is afraid to leave the house due to constant shelling. “Why did they forget about us? We seem to be a total gray area. We are sitting under shelling, I have less than a liter of water left. I have three dogs, two cats, we are all thirsty,” says Vladimir.

description: The Altai Republic saw a record turnout of 71.28% in the presidential election, with Vladimir Putin receiving 86.49% of the vote. The region's success is attributed to national projects and the president's attention, resulting in improved infrastructure, including new schools, kindergartens, and road repairs.
original:
Regions of Russia are summing up the results of the main political event - the presidential election. The consolidation of the residents of our country is obvious: the record turnout speaks of this much more clearly than any other fact. The Altai Republic, where 71.28% of residents showed up at the polling stations, was not spared from the high figures, which is higher than the figures for 2012 and 2018. At the same time, Vladimir Putin was supported by 86.49%, which is the third result in the Siberian Federal District and the best in recent decades.

It was possible to achieve such indicators due to national projects and the close attention of the president to the subject, as stated by the head of the region Oleg Khorokhordin. Over the past five years alone, it has been possible to build more than 30 first aid stations, 21 kindergartens and three new schools. Also, more than 100 public and courtyard areas were landscaped, and more than 800 km of roads were repaired. And after the elections these processes will only intensify.

In general, the vote was an excellent indicator of the successful work of both the regions and the president, which had a positive impact on the quality and standard of living.
